translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Yasas
The Elder Uttara’s Birth Story
“The One Awakened named Sumedha,
with thirty-two excellent signs,
the Fortunate One, desiring solitude,
went to the Himalayas.
Having gone into the Himalayas,
the Foremost One, the Compassionate One, the Sage,
having sat down cross-legged,
sat down, the Foremost of Men.🔽At that time I was a sky-wanderer,

analyzed: vijjādharaḥ tadā āsi  antalikkha caraḥ aha
translated: a magician,
having taken a well-made three-pointed (weapon),
I was going through the sky then.
Just like a fire on a mountain-top,
like the moon on the full moon day,
the Awakened One shines in the forest,
like a flowering Sāl King.
Having come out from the forest-fire,
from the one who makes the Buddha’s radiance fade,

analyzed: naḷaggi vaṇṇa saṅkāsā  disvā cittam pasādayi
translated: having seen (him) with a complexion like a reed,🔽I was gladdened in mind.🔽While searching I saw a flower,
a Kaṇikāra, fragrant like the gods,

analyzed: tīṇi pupphāni ādāya  buddha seṭṭham apūjayi
translated: having taken three flowers,🔽I worshipped the Best of Buddhas.
Through the Buddha’s power,
at that time three flowers of mine
had their stalks above and their petals below,
making shade for the Teacher.
Through that good deed well done,
And by my will and my vow,
Having left the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
There I enjoyed the fruit of my merit,
known as the Kaṇikāra tree;
Sixty leagues in height,
and thirty leagues in breadth.
A thousand branches, a hundred shoots,
with banners and green leaves;
A hundred thousand birds
appeared to me as my enjoyment.
Made of gold, of gems,
and of rubies;
Pillows and couches,
whenever and wherever I desired.
And a very valuable bed,🔽with cotton and silk covers;
And a single blanket,
with a pillow.
Having left the dwelling,
walking on the divine walk;
As I desired to go,
with a retinue of gods in front.
I stood below the flower,
with a canopy above me;
All around a hundred leagues,
covered with kaṇikāra flowers.
Sixty thousand women,
attended on me as I flew;
They always surrounded me,
diligent day and night.
There I delight in dancing and singing,
in music and in play,
I rejoice in the pleasure of sport,
I am happy, I get what I want.
There I eat and drink,
I rejoice in the company of the Thirty-Three,
Together with the groups of women,
I rejoice in the highest pleasure.

analyzed: satānam pañcakkhattum ca  deva rajjam akārayi  satānam tīṇikkhattum ca  cakkavattī ahosaha
translated: For five hundred times I was a king of the gods,🔽for three hundred times I was a king of the world,
and innumerable times I was a king of a small country.
Wandering through existence after existence,
I obtained great wealth;
I never had a lack of wealth,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I wander through two existences,
among the gods and among men;
I do not know of any other state of existence,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I am reborn in two families,
in the families of nobles and brahmins;
I do not know of a low family,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I obtain an elephant-carriage, a horse-carriage,
a palanquin carried by men,
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I obtain a group of female slaves, a group of male slaves,
Women adorned with ornaments;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Silk, woolen, linen, and cotton;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
New clothes, new fruits,
new food with new flavors;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Eat this, enjoy this,
sleep on this bed;
I obtain all of these,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Everywhere I am worshipped,
my fame is greatly exalted;
I always have a great following,
my retinue is always inseparable;
I am the foremost of my relatives,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I do not know cold or heat,
fever does not exist for me;
And mental suffering,
does not exist in my heart.
Having become golden-colored,
I wander through existence and rebirth;
I do not know ugliness,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Having fallen from the deva world,
urged on by the root of merit,
I was born in the city of Savatthi,
in a great house, in the middle.
Abandoning the five strands of sense pleasure,
I went forth into homelessness;
Seven years after my birth,
I attained perfection.
The Buddha, who had reached perfection,
who had vision, who knew my qualities,
Though young, I was worthy of worship;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.

analyzed: dibba cakkhu visuddham me  samādhi kusalaḥ aha
translated: My divine eye is purified,🔽I am skilled in concentration,
I have reached perfection in direct knowledge;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
I have attained the discriminations,🔽I am skilled in the bases of spiritual power,
I have reached perfection in the qualities;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
For thirty thousand eons,
I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not know of any bad destination;
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four discriminations,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā uttaro thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai uttaraḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus have I heard: on one occasion the Venerable Elder Uttara recited these verses.
The Elder Uttara’s Story is the sixth.
